channel.title: Every query on a table with a name that has a special character returns an error
channel.description: Every query on a table with a name that has a special character returns an error. ![image (5)|690x222](upload://hPxH5IuXRpHKszHNNzqswdfRMwd.png) ERROS MSG: Error running query: 'utf8' codec can´t decode byte 0xa0 in position 7:invalid start byte

item.title: Every query on a table with a name that has a special character returns an error
item.dc:creator: jesse
item.description:
Thanks.

It sounds like this is a problem with how cx_oracle is returning data from your queries.

I found this link which discusses a similar issue. You can see if it’s possible to modify the settings on your Oracle database to return results in UTF8 format. Alternatively, it may be possible to modify the Redash source code in oracle.py to set the return format whenever Redash connects.

Read full topic
item.source: Every query on a table with a name that has a special character returns an error

item.title: Every query on a table with a name that has a special character returns an error

item.description:
We are using Redash version: 8.0.2.b37747 OS: Windows Server 2016 Datacenter. Install in docker. Oracle.
